articles.headline: Gold price today in India (January 23, 2026): 24K at ₹15,971, 22K at ₹14,640; Silver rises
articles.summary: On January 23, 2026, gold prices in India saw a decline while silver prices rose. The 24‑karat gold rate stood at ₹15,971 per 10 grams, and 22‑karat at ₹14,640. This marks a shift in the recent trend of rising gold prices.
articles.detailed_summary:
• 24‑karat gold price dropped to ₹15,971 per 10 grams
• 22‑karat gold price stood at ₹14,640 per 10 grams
• Silver prices experienced an upward movement on the same day
• The decline in gold prices contrasts with previous sessions of strong upward momentum
• The update provides city‑wise rates including Chennai, Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata
articles.context: Gold and silver prices in India are closely watched indicators of economic sentiment and inflation expectations. Gold, especially 24K and 22K, is a popular investment and cultural asset, while silver often reflects industrial demand. Price fluctuations can influence consumer behavior and investment decisions.

articles.headline: Goa & Dubai dominate Republic Day weekend travel
articles.summary: Travel interest surged during the Republic Day weekend (January 23–26, 2026), with domestic accommodation searches up 115% and international searches up 63% year-on-year. Goa was the most searched domestic destination, while Dubai led internationally. Pondicherry, Udaipur, Varkala, and Ooty also saw significant increases.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Domestic accommodation searches rose by 115% compared to the previous year
• International searches increased by 63% year‑on‑year
• Goa emerged as the top domestic travel destination
• Dubai was the most searched international destination
• Pondicherry (+211%), Udaipur (+148%), Varkala (+188%), and Ooty (+182%) recorded strong growth in searches
articles.context: Republic Day weekend is one of India’s major travel periods, often prompting spikes in tourism. Goa is a perennial favorite for domestic travelers, while Dubai remains a top international choice. The data reflects shifting preferences and the growing appeal of both established and emerging destinations.

articles.headline: Linkin Park to make first‑ever India appearance after making fans wait two decades
articles.summary: Iconic rock band Linkin Park will perform in India for the first time on January 23, 2026, in Bengaluru, followed by a headline slot at Lollapalooza India in Mumbai on January 25. The long-awaited debut marks a major cultural moment for Indian fans.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Linkin Park will perform in Bengaluru on January 23, 2026
• The band will also headline Lollapalooza India 2026 in Mumbai on January 25
• This marks their first-ever performances in India after over two decades of anticipation
• The announcement has generated excitement among fans nationwide
• The shows represent a significant cultural milestone for India’s live music scene
articles.context: Linkin Park, formed in 1996, is known for hits like “Numb,” “In the End,” and “Crawling.” Their music blends rock, hip-hop, and electronic elements, earning global acclaim. Lollapalooza is a major international music festival, and its India edition brings global artists to Indian audiences.

articles.headline: Chennai to witness the Navagraha Symphony
articles.summary: On January 23, 2026, Chennai will host the Indian premiere of the Navagraha Symphony, led by violin maestro Dr. L. Subramaniam. The performance, part of the 35th Lakshminarayana Global Music Festival, blends Western symphonic structure with Indian cultural elements.
articles.detailed_summary:
• The Navagraha Symphony will premiere in India on January 23, 2026, in Chennai
• Violin maestro Dr. L. Subramaniam will lead the performance
• The event is part of the 35th Lakshminarayana Global Music Festival
• The production includes a full symphony orchestra, choir, soloists, and dancers
• The symphony fuses Western classical form with Indian cosmological themes
articles.context: The Navagraha Symphony draws inspiration from Indian cosmology, specifically the nine celestial bodies (Navagrahas). Dr. L. Subramaniam is a renowned violinist known for blending Indian classical music with Western forms. The Lakshminarayana Global Music Festival is an annual event celebrating global musical traditions.

articles.headline: ‘Rashtragranth’: First‑ever large‑scale play on the Constitution of India to officially launch across Maharashtra this Republic Day
articles.summary: "Rashtragranth," a Marathi theatre production based on the Constitution of India, will officially launch across Maharashtra in February 2026, coinciding with Republic Day. After successful pilot performances in nine districts, the play aims to promote constitutional awareness and civic dialogue.
articles.detailed_summary:
• "Rashtragranth" is the first large‑scale play based on the Indian Constitution
• Pilot performances were held across nine districts of Maharashtra with positive reception
• The play was initially unveiled on January 26 of the previous year in the presence of Dr. Ambedkar’s grandson
• It is set for an official public launch across Maharashtra beginning February 2026, aligned with Republic Day
• The initiative is supported by the Department of Cultural Affairs, Government of Maharashtra
articles.context: The Constitution of India, adopted in 1950, is the supreme law of the land. Theatre has long been used as a medium to educate and engage citizens on civic values. Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, principal architect of the Constitution, is a central figure in its history.
